task: Determine the convergence or divergence of the series Σ (n=1 to ∞) of 1/(n^3 + 1).
Determine the convergence or divergence of the series Σ (n=1 to ∞) of 1/(n^3 + 1).
user_action_and_explanation: type 'convergence of sum 1/(n^3 + 1) from n=1 to infinity' into the input bar to determine the convergence or divergence of the series using WolframAlpha's computation capabilities.
observation: The WolframAlpha page indicates that the series \( \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{n^3 + 1} \) converges. An approximated sum is provided, showing the calculated value to converge around 0.686491.
